intro: Selliguea taeniata var. palmata, commonly known as the palmate rock moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately divided leaves that give it a fern-like appearance. This plant typically grows on moist, shaded rock surfaces in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually green to reddish in color and may bear small, rounded structures called gemmae. The plant is often found in humid environments, where it thrives in the presence of consistent moisture and shade.
